intro: Campylotheca macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited campylotheca, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pink flowers. Its fruits are woody, capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
